TopicTitle: [1.1.3] TAC - Life Support v0.12.2 - Release 03 JULY 2016

Articles.Content: Definitely one of the must have mods on my list.  I've tried USI-Life Support, and even gave Kerbalism a try out - but I come back to TAC-LS as my go to Life Support mod.
I installed the mod but my game won't load, no error. Is their something it may not be combadibile with?
The latest release only seems to have a source file?

1 hour ago, superkurbol2014 said:

I installed the mod but my game won't load, no error. Is their something it may not be combadibile with?

give more info. for example the freezes or the progress bar to load wont move etc.

50 minutes ago, Temeter said:

The latest release only seems to have a source file?

I think there's a typo. The link leads to 0.12.1, but the releases page leads to v0.12.1, which has a zip file.
https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/tag/v0.12.1
The source file download i used seems to work just fine too.

2 minutes ago, Temeter said:

The source file download i used seems to work just fine too.

Ah, I see. It has the source AND the binaries.

28 minutes ago, Gryphon said:

Ah, I see. It has the source AND the binaries.

Yep!

So, the download link is this:

https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/tag/0.12.1

but should be:

https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/latest

I installed this correctly, and it works, but I cannot go in to the Vehicle Assembly Building.https://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwyTWBPXcCgvWTRhak1nX0xKM2Mhttps://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwyTWBPXcCgvaEJCVGI5Z1dySkE
@BirchMonkey857any logs?
@Phineas Freak nope. It also won't let me save or exit. I have to go to the desktop and close it there.

8 hours ago, BirchMonkey857 said:

@Phineas Freak nope. It also won't let me save or exit. I have to go to the desktop and close it there.

Open the Debug Console in game ALT+F2 and then try clicking the VAB. You should see angry red text appear in the box. Try to get a screen shot of it.

Also: You don't need to save or quit to get a log, as it starts generating as soon as the game does.

-----------------------

@danfarnsy I already tagged you about this in the Deepfreeze Thread, but it belongs here, so here it be. Recovering a Frozen Kerbal results in TACLS throwing a fit and spamming the log (see contents below) a mile a minute. Note: it doesn't kill the Kerbal, it's just seems to be trying to clean up the record of the recovered Kerbal (I had previously recovered a frozen Jeb). He is still alive and well.

Thanks again for picking this mod up.

Cheers.

Something in the deep freeze wrapper included in the latest update. I'll see if I can reproduce it and narrow it down.

14 hours ago, danfarnsy said:

Something in the deep freeze wrapper included in the latest update. I'll see if I can reproduce it and narrow it down.

Actually, I think that little report occurred at the INFO level, so I don't think the player normally sees that. Might have left a switch thrown that I shouldn't have. My bad.

2 hours ago, Deimos Rast said:

Actually, I think that little report occurred at the INFO level, so I don't think the player normally sees that. Might have left a switch thrown that I shouldn't have. My bad.

I can't reproduce the error anyway... The code looks the same as the PR I submitted and that was working fine since December? or earlier... so not sure what's going on there.
I'll try again tomorrow to see if I can reproduce it. But I wouldn't worry about it too much for now.

On 6/8/2016 at 7:16 PM, Deimos Rast said:

Open the Debug Console in game ALT+F2 and then try clicking the VAB. You should see angry red text appear in the box. Try to get a screen shot of it.

Also: You don't need to save or quit to get a log, as it starts generating as soon as the game does.

@danfarnsy I already tagged you about this in the Deepfreeze Thread, but it belongs here, so here it be. Recovering a Frozen Kerbal results in TACLS throwing a fit and spamming the log (see contents below) a mile a minute. Note: it doesn't kill the Kerbal, it's just seems to be trying to clean up the record of the recovered Kerbal (I had previously recovered a frozen Jeb). He is still alive and well.

Thanks again for picking this mod up.

Cheers.

@BirchMonkey857

Looking at the screenshot unfortunately just says it's a generic NRE description. Can you try to get a log again? I know you said you had issues with it last time. Try creating a copy of the log and uploading that to GDrive. See the info below for which log. Sorry.

 

  • Windows: KSP_win\KSP_Data\output_log.txt (32bit) or KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\output_log.txt (64bit)
  • Mac OS X: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log ( Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log )
  • Linux: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal\ Space\ Program/Player.log

@BirchMonkey857

Looking at the screenshot unfortunately just says it's a generic NRE description. Can you try to get a log again? I know you said you had issues with it last time. Try creating a copy of the log and uploading that to GDrive. See the info below for which log. Sorry.

  • Mac OS X: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log ( Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log )
  • Linux: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal\ Space\ Program/Player.log

is something going on with CKAN? it keeps giving me this error: 

Failed to download "https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/download/0.12.1/TacLifeSupport-0.12.1.zip" - error: The request was aborted: The connection was closed unexpectedly.

12 hours ago, crasher925 said:

is something going on with CKAN? it keeps giving me this error: 

Failed to download "https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/download/0.12.1/TacLifeSupport-0.12.1.zip" - error: The request was aborted: The connection was closed unexpectedly.

Did you check to see if you can download that file manually? (Of course not). I get "404 Not Found".

A quick look at https://github.com/KSP-RO/TacLifeSupport/releases/ tells me that the correct URL has "v0.12.1" not "0.12.1".

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-meta/blob/master/TACLS/TACLS-v0.12.1.ckan has and from the history has always had the correct URL in. Is there something you're not telling us? Did you copytype not cut and paste that error message?
